reviews.review: Fun game. Kinda hard though, and now infested with hackers, but...fun. Couldn't recommend more for those interested in the era when Valve actually made things, and quality things at that. The countless memes and videos made with the assets and characters from these games could probably overload a NASA supercomputer for a reason.

what happened to my life
Your Steam account isn't for real until you've played TF2.

Quando as pessoas me perguntam por que eu acho TF2 tão bom, eu respondo: “Em que outro FPS você encontra personagens amáveis, servers onde os players simplesmente param de lutar e começam a dançar (não são aquelas dancinhas do Fortnite não, essas danças não são tão enjoativas) e armas que são, sem tirar nem pôr, um jarro contendo urina e uma garrafa cheia de uma substância branca que não é leite?”
   O ponto é que Team Fortress 2 é único. Uma inovação na indústria ligeiramente repetitiva dos FPS.
   Todas as 9 classes do jogo possuem um jeito diferente de jogar, trazendo bastante variedade aos conflitos do jogo, cada uma com habilidades e armas que as tornam interessantes.
   Falando em armas, os desenvolvedores fizeram um bom criando os equipamentos do game, implementando mecânicas criativas e sempre procurando balanceá-las, adicionando buffs e nerfs se comparados às armas iniciais (por exemplo digamos que exista o revólver “Aniquilador” que possui + 10% de dano, porém -10% de velocidade de disparo se comparado ao revólver padrão), o que além de tornar o jogo mais justo, também faz com que as armas com que você começa sejam “consistentes” e não pedaços de lixo sem nenhuma graça que nem em jogos pay-to-win que já existem em abundância na indústria dos jogos.
   Outro motivo pelo qual TF2 é tão adorado é por sua comunidade. Mesmo o jogo tendo sido abandonado há muito tempo, os fãs continuam extremamente engajados e produzindo conteúdo de qualidade a respeito do game, como vídeos e animações muito bem feitas.
   Uma das razões que também mantém o Team Fortress 2 vivo até hoje são seus personagens. Além de serem únicos em combate, também possuem personalidades bem distintas que são representadas por seus diálogos no jogo e pelos famosos vídeos “Meet the”, que são pequenos anúncios que a Valve (desenvolvedora do game) produziu para demonstrar as habilidades das classes e suas características. 
   Mas, infelizmente, nem tudo é um mar de rosas. O principal problema do jogo é a negligência da Valve a respeito de sua criação, que não recebe atualizações significativas há 5 anos. Enfim, com o estado da empresa hoje em dia, lançando pouquíssimos jogos, eu pessoalmente duvido que um novo update chegue ao jogo, mas afinal, sonhar é de graça… Assim como esse jogo! Por isso, se eu pudesse resumir essa pagação de pau em forma de review seria: Dê uma chance ao jogo! Ele é de 2007 então roda até em uma batata. Sério mesmo, tente!
If you're looking for a mixture of goofy, cartoon-y, crude, and violent, this is the right game for you!!

Extraño muchísimo esos tiempos que llegaba a casa con solo ganas de jugarlo. 
Es una tristeza enorme como Valve desaprovecha sus juegos y los abandona. Pero eso muestra lo dedicada y hermosa que es esta comunidad. Siempre tendrá un lugar como el juego que mas horas dedique y mas me entretuvo.
If you want to play a multiplayer game that is actually fun with friends, has a great genuinly freindly community, and fun gameplay that never gets old, play this game.

one of the most creative and innovative shooters of all time with one of the best cast of characters seen in a game. it has one of the most diehard communitys keeping it alive and some of the funniest trailers and videos made for it. i have been playing this game for about 8 years now and i have no intention on stopping now despite a lack of updates. i love you tf2 thank you for long nights with friends, many laughs, and many dollars spent on hats.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead– murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time – something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange – uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" – on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.
